meanings.definition: A person who drinks alcohol or other liquids.
meanings.sent1: The party was full of enthusiastic imbibers enjoying their drinks.
meanings.sent2: The bar was crowded with imbibers sipping on their cocktails.
meanings.sent3: The imbibers at the picnic were having a 'sip-off' competition.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the queen of imbibers, always trying new drinks.
meanings.sent5: The group of imbibers made the bar lively with their laughter and chatter.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that allows liquids to be absorbed or consumed.
meanings.sent1: The sponge acted as a great imbibers, soaking up all the spilled water.
meanings.sent2: The straw was a useful imbibers for drinking the juice from the cup.
meanings.sent3: The imbibers in the water filter ensured clean drinking water for the family.
meanings.sent4: The paper towel served as an efficient imbibers for wiping up the spilled milk.
meanings.sent5: The plant roots function as natural imbibers, drawing water from the soil.
